response.answer_text: One of the most popular girls’ colleges under Delhi University, Jesus and Mary College is few of the Colleges in Delhi University which gives a unique social culture to the students other than offering a wide array of courses and a conducive learning environment. The alumni of the college are prepared not only for their respective subjects, but for life. The chances of admission to the college are highly unlikely if you have secured anything less than 75% in your 12th standard. Only 700 girls will get a chance to be a part of this prestigious college this year. 50% of the seats are reserved for the students of Christian minority in the college, 5% for admission under sports category, 3% for physically handicapped and 5% of the seats are reserved for children and widows of armed forces personnel killed or disabled in action. The college also offers certain specialized vocational courses in several fields. The college festival called Montage is one of the most colourful festivals in Delhi University and is a spot for some mind blowing performances. The college has a well equipped computer laboratory and gives ample opportunities for physical activity to the students. Companies like Google, KPMG, Deloitte and MC Kinsey pick students for placement from this college every year. DU, name is enough!!

Jesus and Mary College is a premiere women-only college affiliated to the University of Delhi located in New Delhi. The college awards bachelor's degrees in commerce, arts and mathematics. The college offers honors degree in : Elementary education, History, Sociology, Political Science, Hindi, English, Economics, Psychology, Math and Commerce. The college is located in Chanakyapuri in New Delhi. The college was founded by Religious of Jesus and Mary, a Roman Catholic Congregation founded by St. Claudine Thevenet or known as Mary of St. Ignatius in Lyon, France in 1818. Convent of Jesus and Mary, Delhi was established in 1919, and thereafter a college for women in Delhi and the college was founded in July 1968. At the time of opening, the college offered only two degrees: English and BA, but quickly expanded to offer degrees in other subjects. Jesus and Mary College is one of the few colleges in the University of Delhi whose student body is not affiliated with Delhi University Students Union.
